website_summaries.verdict: The fixed LCD and lack of built-in wireless file transfer support may make some people cross it off their short list, but the Canon EOS 7D Mark II should please any Canon fan looking for speed.
pros: Preserving its familiar and weather-sealed design, the 7D Mark II builds on the best of its predecessor: it's speedy with excellent photo and video quality, GPS, a flexible autofocus system and a big, bright viewfinder
cons: No tilting or articulated display makes shooting video without a rig annoying, and it lacks built-in Wi-Fi

website_summaries.verdict: The Canon EOS 7D Mark II shoots at 10fps, offers pro-level video recording, and is built like a tank. It's our Editors' Choice for high-end APS-C D-SLRs.
pros: Lots of detail at high ISO
cons: Servo AF unavailable when shooting at 1080p60

customer_reviews.title: Roll the dice on warranty
customer_reviews.text: I was warned about buying Canon bodies on Amazon, but saving $500 was too enticing. Just received my 7Dmii, it appears to be a new body, though the packaging had clearly been gone through (box dividers we’re out of place and LCD protectors were missing). Additionally, this ended up being a “grey market” camera so I don’t get a warranty, even though I had checked in the questions prior to purchasing that other people received a U.S. version.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Rohde

customer_reviews.title: No warranty card, makes me wonder (bought from Shutter Stop via Amazon)
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: Just spoke with Canon, the camera is from the US, but Shutter Stop is not an authorized Canon dealer, so there is no warranty. Camera appears to be new, but there was no warranty card included, no software CD, and the box indicates that it should include the wifi/SD card, but was not included (which wasn't the model I purchased, so not a big deal). All of this makes me question this purchase, but I was able to register the serial number, so I now I don't know what to think.
customer_reviews.author: M. Shetz

customer_reviews.title: Good camera, but no auto feature with the flash off.
customer_reviews.text: I got this after using a Rebel for a long time (multiple different models), and I find it a little more cumbersome. The tech hasn't really been updated since it was originally designed and there is no flash-off auto feature, which would have been nice. The other thing that bugs me (and this might be user error) is the auto focus that keeps refocusing when you move the frame so you can't select your focal point and then reframe the shot. Very sturdy, overall good picture quality, but I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Home & Hosting

customer_reviews.title: Gray Market Camera
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE! I bought a new Canon 7d Mark ii from Amazon less than a year ago. It started taking a long time to boot up when I turned it on, thus missing some shots sometimes. The CF card slot did not accept a card. I sent in to Canon for “covered repair” since it was not a year old. They first said it would be free but a day later called and said it would be $450 to repair since it was not made in the United States. It’s what they call a gray market camera. Will never buy a camera on Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis McGinnes

customer_reviews.title: This is a great camera for the $$
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera for the $$. Light, fast, fast and fast. Durable as well - I just replaced my older 7D with this - after nearly a million clicks - not kidding. Used for endurance sports photography; marathon, trail runs, XC running, triathlon (from in, not on, the lakes) cyclocross, skiing, mountain biking, swimming, track and field.... so rain, snow, dust, dark, pools, bumps, mud.... and nearly a million clicks. And shot for glossy magazine covers, two-page spreads, national publishers - i.e. great quality images. Great camera for the $$.
customer_reviews.author: David Mable

customer_reviews.title: This camera is great. Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great. Easy to use, tough as hell, works at night well, and reliable. If you don't mind crop frame, it's a fantastic purchase. Been all over the world with me, in bad weather, dusty terrain, and through a lot of "whoops" moments. Worth using, keeping, fixing, and using again. I've only used 3-4 lenses on it, but mostly stuck with a 35AF. It's a tight shot up close with that one, but if you drop in a larger lens scope, it's good for anything. No disappointments with it based on the sell package. It's lived up to my hopes and more.
customer_reviews.author: SOJJ

customer_reviews.title: Amazing affordable sports camera
customer_reviews.text: My brother uses this mainly for shooting his sons baseball games. It's kinda like a junior 1DX for those of us who can't afford the big boy version! ;) He had an older 40D(?) and would maybe get one good shot out of 100. Now it's almost the opposite. I personally have a 5D2 and was really impressed by the handling, continuous shutter speed, focusing, etc. etc. etc. I can't imagine how much better this would be paired with L glass!!
customer_reviews.author: Oh Yeah

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS NOT A USA PRODUCT, IT IS GRAY MARKET!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Links to warranties on this product page inaccurately show Canon USA warranties. Canon USA will NOT register your product warranty. Other gray market seller include the word INTERNATIONAL in their product headline. This seller should do the same, but chose not to do so. That is a very unwise and misleading tactic. I am returning the product without using it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: i was amazed at the pictures i was taking with the 18 ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for photographing wildlife!! I have been using a Pentax K-3 and i knew from reading that this camera was faster but i had no idea how much faster!! I was shooting birds back and forth!! I had a few pics out of focus at first but that was due to me not focusing correctly because i was pushing too much on the shutter button!! Once i realized just a little finger pressure focuses in, i was amazed at the pictures i was taking with the 18 - 135mm!! I can't wait to see what happens when i put a long lens on it!! I LOVE THIS CAMERA!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anita M. Corwin

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for Wildlife Photography
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use for wildlife photography and only use the manual mode and it does the job! I like the fact it has a silent mode for single and multiple pictures when I am close to a subject; and once I developed my sense of touch I could use the high speed modes to get a single shot or a high speed sequence in either silent or true high speed mode. I can also use it along with a monopod and 600mm lens when I am working from my kayak because the body is not bulky. Since I work in the outdoors and carry a GPS, I use neither of these features.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: Doing a lot of traveling I like all of my photos to be geo-tagged so I know where I took them. This camera performs well overall. Have taken it halfway around the world and it performed better overall than I expected. Used the GPS function all the time and the battery held up very well. I could easily count on getting 7-8 hours of use before I had to switch to my backup battery. Picture quality was excellent. Only downside was the manual was not written as clearly as I would normally expect from Canon.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Miller

customer_reviews.title: NO WARRANTY CARD INCLUDED
customer_reviews.text: The camera had no warranty card and the serial number could not be registered. Documentation is from Canon Europa. The listing did not indicate that there would be no warranty. The camera is being returned
customer_reviews.author: F Peter Michaelis

customer_reviews.title: Of course this thing is great
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for my wifes 7D Mark I camera that ended up with an error 30. Worked perfectly as soon as we got it. The Mark II has different settings and menu options so she is having to relearn where everything is. But I used it for a night and it makes you feel like a professional photographer. Of course, I was taking pictures of remote control car racing, so every picture is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: jteamazonstuff

customer_reviews.title: A bit Older, but still a great shooter!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a bit long in the tooth for Canon, but it is packed with features and takes great photos and videos. I was originally looking at purchasing the 5D Mark IV, but chose this camera instead. The 10FPS is second only to the 1DX in Canon's lineup, and you can't beat the 65 AF points at this price point. if you're more than a hobbyist, then plan on getting the battery grip and an extra battery. Also, if you'd like to connect to your camera via the Canon app, then also get the WiFi Card as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ibn

customer_reviews.title: Good for wildlife and sports photography
customer_reviews.text: I like the 7D II for wildlife and sports photography. The 1.6 crop factor offer higher magnification of the subject, and I can shoot at a very high rate of frames per second. The camera performs better than the 7D I at high ISO, though not as well as a full frame camera (i.e. 5D). So, recommended for wildlife and sports photography, though not as good as a full frame camera for landscape
customer_reviews.author: Faboza

customer_reviews.title: Purchased used Canon Mark II (Body only)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this canon mark II (body only) in April 2017 and it just died on me. I go to canon to have it serviced but the serial number that's on the camera canon says that its not eligible for service because its not a us product. I go to look at who I purchased it from and in the description it DOES NOT state that its an out of country product. It was sold to me under false pretenses and this person should not be TRUSTED!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Derrick

customer_reviews.title: Its a work horse.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera as my first professional camera. I love it! I have brought it pretty much everywhere with me (Africa, Eastern Europe, Central America, Canada) and stuffed it in my bag and had it tossed around. It hasn't given up on me yet and its been 5 years or rough wear and tear. I truly love this camera and it is a great one for younger less experienced photographers who are wanting to be more serious. Its easy to use and take great photos.
customer_reviews.author: JULIA ANDREWS

customer_reviews.title: Very solid worker
customer_reviews.text: Friends in the business questioned why I purchased this camera body, when I've been using a 7D for several years. First, I know how to work it. Shooting news images, I don't have time to learn a whole new operating system and button placement. And, it has much better low light capability. This, plus dual cards, better autofocus -- I'm glad I could send my old 7D off for repair (I burned out the shutter switch after thousands of clicks) and make it the backup body in my case.
customer_reviews.author: Portland Fella

customer_reviews.title: Absolutey amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this camera. Its extremely robust, well built and user friendly. Ive shot wverything from sports in 100 defree weather, to the international ice carving competiton and the iditarod in negative 20 or lower. The camera never missed a beat. Its autofocus speed and frame rate are absolutely lightning fast. For the price, this is definitely the best deal out there.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Digital Village is NOT an authorized dealer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this back in September and had forgotten to register the product with Canon. When I finally got around to doing that I couldn't because I was informed this was a "grey market" item which means there is NO warranty on it if something happens. On the product listing, Digital Village specifically lied and listed they were an authorized dealer and made no mention about the item being International, grey market, or having no warranty. I love the camera body and was replacing an EOS 7D but be warned about buying this from this seller!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Underwood

customer_reviews.title: A very good camera at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: An excellent camera with numerous features. I bought it to complement my 5D II. The 7D II has so many "modern" features that the 5D II does not have. The learning curve is steep, but it is a great camera. I love the extra reach a 1.6 crop camera provides and the frames/second advantage over the 5D II. Lastly, the 7D II feels great in the hands. I love large DSLRs, and the 7D II feels solid and the buttons and switches are well placed (similar to the 5D III). I am very happy with my 7D II.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: for what i read in reviews the 7DMII is like a mini 1Dx
customer_reviews.text: for the little buffer of the nikon D7100 I made the switch to Canon for this camera the other thing was the 10fps. for what i read in reviews the 7DMII is like a mini 1Dx. the great AF fully exceeded my expectations in every way, It is fast and accurate. The 7D ii is built extremely well and the controls are superior. the dual card slots (CF/SD) is really excellent. The menu system great, well laid out and informative
customer_reviews.author: gogolac

customer_reviews.title: Bought for the GPS function
customer_reviews.text: I am interested in photographing wildlife and this came recommended for the GPS feature. It works but drains the battery even when off. Imagine my reaction early in the morning at a location and no power! You must remember to keep the battery out of the camera until you are ready to shoot. Support by Canon is great. They answer questions very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great camera but warranty not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: After spending considerable time researching prices I chose to buy from PixiBytes because they had the best price for what they advertise as having a US warranty  When you click the link next to warranty information a pdf of the us warrantee comes up but when I got the camera there was no warranty and the serial number was no recognized by canon USA and the box was not USA packaging
customer_reviews.author: joanne edmunds

customer_reviews.title: Grey market item, unusable from Ted's Electronics
customer_reviews.text: Grey market item, no owners manual or warranty card; language set to Japanese with no instructions for changing it. Does not come WiFi equipped like the real 7DmarkII.
customer_reviews.author: Page Hall

customer_reviews.title: Just amazing! It was worth the wait to get this ...
customer_reviews.text: Just amazing! It was worth the wait to get this 7D Mark II upgrade. Auto-focus is wonderful, image quality amazing and noise reduction at high ISO is fantastic. I a very happy with this camera. I am what could be considered as advanced amateur or prosumer photographer and this camera has allowed me to take my skills to the next level. If I had the money, I would buy another as a back-up
customer_reviews.author: Roy-E

customer_reviews.title: Canon 7D Mark ii, well worth my wait.
customer_reviews.text: I have waited 7 long years to upgrade my tried and true Canon 50D, and I am extremely happy that I waited. I shoot primary sports and candid photography, and this Canon 7D Mark ii is truly incredible. A lot of the events that I shoot are at night, in poorly lit arenas. Though I was able to finesse my 50D into getting some usable shots, I had a far greater success rate with the 7Dii. The speed of the 10 frames a second coupled with the ability to get usable shots upwards of 16000 ISO really makes this the perfect camera for my type of shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Vorpalrat

customer_reviews.title: THIS CAMERA BODY IS NOT ADVERTISED AS AN INTERNATIONAL MODEL, WHICH IT TURNS OUT TO BE
customer_reviews.text: I ordered and received this camera body. It was advertised without any verification that it was an International body. Therefore, Canon will not allow it to be registered! I notified this company in writing twice, immediately asking specifically if it was an international model and that if it was I would be sending it back and wanted the Canon body which I could register on Canon's website. I have heard absolutely nothing from this company. Clearly false advertisement!! And they are supposedly a Canon representative on the Amazon website! Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Gehm

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice -- good upgrade over 7D
customer_reviews.text: A considerable upgrade from the 7D, this camera has improved focus capability, faster FPS (10 vs 8), and a higher sensitivity image sensor. All these add up to better pictures, especially if you shoot action sports shots like I do. After 3 months, the camera has worked flawlessly. Complaints about auto focus I read in other reviews have not materialized for me, but then I understand this camera's capabilities pretty well. I highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: jksurferdad

customer_reviews.title: Great like new
customer_reviews.text: Was about to purchase at original price New but saw this refurbished like new for $300 less and took the chance. Camera body came like new with all accessories. No dents, scratches or signs or wear or use. SO HAPPY!!
customer_reviews.author: torres

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful camera
customer_reviews.text: Clear and crisp photos! This camera has a lot of features that I have yet to unveil but even the standard features are phenomenal! I purchased 3 lenses with this camera and each work beautifully. It did come with a battery which I didn’t expect, so extra perk there. It’s not a light camera by an means but I appreciate the feel of something durable.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: The 7D is well reviewed camera and it has all the features for bird photography, great for telephoto and fast action birds in flight. Has worked great now for over a year now. Access to modes for focus, iso, metering are awesome.
customer_reviews.author: rben

customer_reviews.title: Fast & sharp !
customer_reviews.text: If you need speed, get one ! It is fast and with its crop-sensor it gives some extra length with any fast lens. It is a great sport/action and very robust camera and I use it in combo with my EF-L 70-200 F2.8 II IS and the EF-L 100-400. Fast and sharp ! Only built-in Wifi is missing (but you can't the Canon Wifi SD card transmitter.....better than nothing).
customer_reviews.author: Peer Kroner

customer_reviews.title: Instruction manual not in English
customer_reviews.text: The instruction manual that came with this camera is only in Spanish, not in English. There was no indication that this wound be the case from the ad. I reached out to the seller to exchange for an English version but they told me to find it online and download it. For a new camera I need an instruction manual that can be used in the field so I'm going to have to buy one. I'm removing one star for the inconvenience, one star for the false marketing, and one star for poor customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Sports Photography Camera
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the 50D to the 7D and I am happy with the purchase. It has so many options you can choose from that it will take you months to know them all. I would not recommend this camera for a novice as you have so many other camera options for a lower price. The only complaint I have is with the video recording. It only records in 1080, but I guess in 2014, that was the high end at the time.
customer_reviews.author: Jose U. Mejía

customer_reviews.title: This is the best camera IMO for this price range
customer_reviews.text: Sold all my Nikon gear to buy this and go over to Canon. This is the best camera IMO for this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Navratil

customer_reviews.title: 7D is the upgrade for the experienced amateur with semi-pro use.
customer_reviews.text: Since my Canon 50D is discontinued, I needed to upgrade. The 6D was my other option, but I have an EFS lens that I use and enjoy so the 7D was the one I chose.
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: ... up to a 10 frame per second burst mode perfect for wildlife photography
customer_reviews.text: Feature packed DSLR with up to a 10 frame per second burst mode perfect for wildlife photography. All Canon EF and EF-S lenses can be used on this camera. It has an APS-C size sensor which gives a 1.6x boost to all EF series lenses, for instance, a 100mm EF lens becomes effectively a 160mm lens. Well made and ergonomically thought out. Built in GPS, level, two data card slots (one for CF and the other for SDHC) and so much more. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bill McCreary

customer_reviews.title: Good portrait lens used at distance for stealth street work
customer_reviews.text: Pro level body. To many superlatives. An other extraordinary addition to my canon kit. Used with the 100mm macro yields 160 mm focal length.Good portrait lens used at distance for stealth street work.
customer_reviews.author: mikep

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Much quieter than the 7D, and it has auto focus for the video which is great. I was hesitant to replace the 7D, but am glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Brian R. Field

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade fom my 50D
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, very fast and effective autofocus system and a nice control layout. Body fits my hand well and the photos look great. I tried using the camera with and older, slower CF card I had laying around and the buffer took a long time to empty, make sure you get fast cards for this camera, at the rate it shoots it does not take long to fill the buffer shooting raw.
customer_reviews.author: WDB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Using on a food blog with low f stop fixed lenses. It’s bloody amazing. Remember you need the larger memory card to run the wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Brittoni

customer_reviews.title: EPIC! Wildlife & sports alike.
customer_reviews.text: If you're interested in this camera body and have done any research you should already know ;) 10FPS is amazing! focus is very fast and sharp. If you're into sports or wildlife this is the camera for you! I REALLY REALLY wish it had a wi-fi function but believe me I am a happy camper. Can't wait to really put it to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie M.

customer_reviews.title: Grey Market Camera - Canon WILL NOT HONOR WARRANTY
customer_reviews.text: Bought from PixiBytes. Camara is fine. works great. Tried to register camera so it would be under warranty. Canon says this camera was not intended for sale in US, and will not allow registration and warranty. Fought, and lost. If anything goes wrong with this camera I am screwed. Buyer beware. It is a gray market unit.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl Hoar

customer_reviews.title: Amazing upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Camera is amazing, It took some getting used to and training after coming form a 20D but I can safely say it was worth the upgrade. It's faster takes amazing photos in the dark if on a tripod and when taken with correct lighting in any situation can have a clear beautiful photo.
customer_reviews.author: Cometblack

customer_reviews.title: Excellent “good” camera option
customer_reviews.text: Excellent straight-outta-the-box camera. Was able to get it set up and begin shooting right away. I wish it came with a print manual, but the full .pdf is available online. Paired it with an 18/135 lens for sports photography.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2one

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for 7D/100-400mm owners.
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought the 7D Mark II as an upgrade to my 7D and primarily for use with my Canon 100-400mm Series II lens for bird and wildlife photography. The Series II lens was a big improvement over the Series I, but with the 7D, I still felt I wasn't getting the best performance. The 7D Mark II has produced far more keepers with its 10fps speed and advanced AF features and having center point AF with the addition of a Canon 1.4x TC on my 100-400mm is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: csquared63

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: There’s some strange sound from the flash unit when I move the camera around, but other than that all good. Fees as good as new
customer_reviews.author: Lansothung

customer_reviews.title: I'm a rank amateur at best, but this camera suits my needs very well
customer_reviews.text: I'm a rank amateur at best, but this camera suits my needs very well. Use it for active grandchildren, wildlife, portraits and landscape. More and more experimenting with manual settings has increased the quality of photos. Have several lenses, my favorite being the EF 70-200 f2.8L.
customer_reviews.author: Smokerings

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: Weather sealed... love it !! Remember the first time I used, a carnival parade in my country, when started to rain all other photographers ran for cover, I keep shooting. Love the servo AF while shooting moving subjects.
customer_reviews.author: Yerry Batista

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera that has an abundance of features for just about every photographic situation. Creates wonderful images especially when matched with the Canon 100-400 mm version ll lens.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Jaquess

customer_reviews.title: A great camera. What more can I say
customer_reviews.text: A great camera. What more can I say? I shoot wildlife and the 10 fps lets me capture shots I would have normally missed with a slower DSLR. I've taken off one star only because the images are a little noisier than what you would get from full frame, but really, as far as APS-C cameras go, this is as "pro" as you're ever going to get.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Increased ISO range (and better images at the same ISO settings)
customer_reviews.text: This body is a huge step up over the 7D. Increased ISO range (and better images at the same ISO settings), better matrices of focus points are probably the two biggest advantages. But, you do get an abundance of little extra features as well. I bought this body at the initial price before the drop of $300 or so and still consider it a very good purchase for sports photography. Wildlife photographers are going to like a lot about this body as well.
customer_reviews.author: TrackXCCoach

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera
customer_reviews.text: I was blown away by this camera. I bought this as an upgrade for my Canon 550d. Everything seems to be new for me starting from the controls. 65 auto focus points is a bit overwhelming and I am still trying to learn it. High speed continuous shoot is amazing and I need to order a better SD or CF card to harness it. A slot each for SD and CF card is good and I am yet to decide how to utilize it better. Build quality is far better than my previous SLR and looks like it can go places. Overall I am impressed with 7D Mark II
customer_reviews.author: Anoop

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: great canon body. I've shot 2 weddings and a couple of portraits and this camera delivered fast and sharp images. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: uluru20

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit.
customer_reviews.text: So far the unit has been living up to it rep.
customer_reviews.author: Xquisite

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Love my 7D Mk II. Can't believe how fast the multi-shot shoots. Does great video and still work, but mostly shoot video with this. It's bigger than a 60D, but a whole lot more capable.
customer_reviews.author: K. Strandberg

customer_reviews.title: Great action camera
customer_reviews.text: Yes it's an older camera but for fast action it still holds it's own compared to more recent cameras. Built like a tank and performs like Cannon's 1 series.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great auto focus
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my 70D. The focusing system is really good and you have many different options. Picture quality is good and I consider it to be a significant step up.
customer_reviews.author: djb76207

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera. Very sharp, very fast, very fun to use. If your looking for a pro body camera at a great great price... This is it.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: I got it for sports photography and love it.
customer_reviews.text: Met my expectations. I take gymnastics photos and the speed (10 fps) allows me to capture every actions.
customer_reviews.author: T. Fangyen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera for wildlife work and scenic work
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera for wildlife work and scenic work. Powerful with lots of features got this camer as recommended by a good friend and I am very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Russell J. Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. This is my second 7D mk2 and I primarily use it for sports. It's a fantastic option for those who can't afford the 1D line.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bergman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fast auto-focus!
customer_reviews.text: So far I have been using my camera for my daughters soccer games and am so impressed with its awesome fast auto-focus. Canon always has a great product. At first I was concerned by the forums that were judging the camera by its specs, but they were so wrong. I love this camera and it is a welcome upgrade from my Canon 40D.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a Canon 7D. Big improvement, especially in image quality at high ISO. Very happy. Wish I'd bought this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: T. D. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera in its class
customer_reviews.text: best camera I have owned yet. Great pictures, nice features. The focal point system takes getting used to, but the 64 points are a nice feature. The camera is fast and easy to use when switching from other Canon cameras
customer_reviews.author: Kevin CTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Camera is like new, battery is not
customer_reviews.text: Overall, happy with the camera, but for a camera with a shutter count of 5,000 the battery should be like new as well - the recharge performance is at 2 instead of 3 - telling me that this is a not the battery from this camera. It's a small thing but a bit deceptive.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Dahl

customer_reviews.title: and the biggest advantages are far better low light performance
customer_reviews.text: I have upgraded from a 7D to a 7D II, and the biggest advantages are far better low light performance, and better performance with extenders on my telephoto zoom 100-400 L series. I'm now able to use autofocus with the 1.4 X extender in place, which will mean fewer discarded shots because of focusing issues.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Rosenquist

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for demanding conditions of indoor sports where the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for demanding conditions of indoor sports where the action is fast, the light is poor and a zoom is required. Delivers outstanding shots paired with a 70-200 2.8L IS II USM. 1.6 crop factor gives you 112-320 with no loss of aperture. 10fps lets you capture the perfect moment. The new AF delivers nearly every shot in focus. Image quality excellent up to ISO 1600, very good up to ISO 6400 and good up to ISO 10,000. Anti-flicker capability is key for many indoor sports situations. The metering is outstanding.
